findings.label: Paid During Active Breaches
findings.detail: 4 suppliers received payments while in breach of Companies Act. The lowest breach spend of the 4 East Lancashire councils — mostly minor compliance issues.

findings.label: Highest Transaction Volume
findings.detail: More transactions than Burnley (30,580), Hyndburn (29,804) and Rossendale (42,536) despite a lower total spend of £125M. Driven by Go Plant vehicle hire and FUELMATE fuel payments.

findings.label: Suspected Split Payments
findings.detail: 777 instances of 3+ payments just below approval thresholds in the same week. Many reflect vehicle hire patterns (Go Plant) rather than deliberate threshold avoidance.

findings.label: Fuel Micro-Payments
findings.detail: FUELMATE LTD received 5,047 individual payments averaging £159 each. Consolidating into monthly invoices would significantly reduce admin costs.

findings.label: Year-End Spending Pattern
findings.detail: March spending is flat at 1.0x the monthly average. April is actually the peak month. No evidence of year-end budget rush.

key_findings.title: Marston (Holdings) Ltd: £17.1K paid during active breach
key_findings.description: Filed dormant accounts but receiving council payments for enforcement services. Minor compliance issue but should be reviewed.

key_findings.title: Go Plant Fleet Services: 210+ identical payments of £3,540
key_findings.description: Individual vehicle hire charges for fleet vehicles. Not duplicates — each is a separate vehicle rental, but volume highlights fleet management costs.

key_findings.title: FUELMATE LTD: 5,047 transactions totalling £800.2K
key_findings.description: Averaging £159 per transaction — the council's most frequent supplier by volume. Individual fuel fill-ups rather than consolidated invoicing.

key_findings.title: 49,741 transactions at £125M — highest volume, lowest spend per transaction
key_findings.description: Pendle processes 67% more transactions than Burnley but spends 65% less. Fleet and fuel micro-payments drive the volume — a potential efficiency concern.

key_findings.title: 40 suppliers shared with neighbouring councils — £39.1M total
key_findings.description: Lancashire County Council, Capita, Go Plant and 37 others serve multiple East Lancashire councils. Compare pricing across all 4 councils.

key_findings.title: Go Plant: Hyndburn pays £59.9K avg vs Pendle £1.1K per transaction
key_findings.description: £2.3M across 2,118 transactions at Pendle vs £300K across 5 at Hyndburn. Different usage patterns — Pendle uses weekly vehicle hire where Hyndburn makes occasional large purchases.
